Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list. Probably the " piece of sliced lapis lazuli" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.88, p.188, pl.30)
